repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Ruth A. Woodbury Collection of Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company Photographs
did.abstract: Views of the Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company building and its construction.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of the construction of the Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company factory, exterior views of the factory, and one 1924 photograph of a woman in the factory inspecting cloth. All photographs are attributed to N. L. Stebbins, Boston.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ruth A. Woodbury Collection of Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company Photographs #6879 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 6802: Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company and Indian Head Mills Records

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: American Textile History Museum Collection, gift of Ruth A. Woodbury

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The ATHM # references the accession number given to collections by the American Textile History Museum. These numbers have been kept and tracked for researchers looking for former citations. For images, these numbers will also be the digital object identifier if the item was scanned.

did.unittitle: Entrance to Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company building, ATHM# 0000.1242.1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image depicts the entrance to the Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company building in Salem, Mass., built in 1924. Probably the entrance to the offices. Copy A.

did.unittitle: Entrance to Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company building, ATHM# 0000.1242.2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image depicts the entrance to the Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company building in Salem, Mass., built in 1924. Probably the entrance to the offices. Copy B.

did.unittitle: Construction of Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company building, ATHM# 0000.1242.3

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image depicts the construction of part of the Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company building in Salem, Mass., built in 1924. Workmen visible in front of partially constructed frame; Salem Harbor barely visible in background.

did.unittitle: Cloth inspection, Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company, ATHM# 0000.1242.4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image depicts the cloth inspection room in the Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company building in Salem, Mass., built in 1924. Female employees in the foreground are inspecting cloth; more employees, both male and female, are engaged in folding or packaging material in the background.

did.unittitle: View of Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company complex, ATHM# 0000.1242.5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image depicts a view of the entire Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company complex in Salem, Mass., built in 1924. The entrance is visible in the foreground; weave shed (?) and other manufacturing areas in background. Loaded horse-drawn wagon at freight entrance in foreground. Copy A.

did.unittitle: View of Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company complex, ATHM# 0000.1242.6

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image depicts a view of the entire Naumkeag Steam Cotton Company complex in Salem, Mass., built in 1924. The entrance is visible in the foreground; weave shed (?) and other manufacturing areas in background. Loaded horse-drawn wagon at freight entrance in foreground. Copy B.
